If I reject and move to round 2, the total value to me would be $900,000 (10% less). This means even if I proposed a more favorable split in the next round, I'd be working with less total value from my perspective.

This offer gives me a guaranteed $100,000. If I reject, I might be able to get more in the next round, but I'd also risk Alice rejecting my counter-offer, leading to further rounds and more inflation.

Given the significant asymmetry in this initial offer (10% vs 90%), I believe it's reasonable to try for a better distribution.
